title.narrative: Support to the Ministry of Fin

description.narrative: Support to the Ministry of Finance and Economic Development to Lead in the Coordination of SDGs Implementation in Botswana

activity-description.narrative: LOCATION WHERE THE ACTIVITY IS BEING MANAGED

condition.narrative: Social and environmental sustainability will be enhanced through application of the UNDP Social and Environmental Standards (http://www.undp.org/ses) and related Accountability Mechanism (http://www.undp.org/secu-srm).

description.narrative:
1. A fully operationalized SDGs Secretariat with the relevant tool to work with.
2. SDGs roadmap operational and action plan produced annually to facilitate the implementation of key interventions.
3. Tailor-made training materials on the SDGs available and being fully utilised to training various officers on the localization and mainstreaming of SDGs

comment.narrative:
Output 1: Enhanced Capacity of the MFED through the SDGs National Secretariat to ably Coordinate and Lead the Implementation of SDGs in Botswana - Recruitment of the Project Manager within the SDGs National Secretariat - Training of Ministerial SDG Focal Points on Roles and responsibilities - 2 National steering committee meeting held for project oversight purposed; annual workplan consideration, implementation tracking
Output 2: Enhanced capacities of sector ministries and departments at national and subnational levels to plan for the localization and mainstreaming of the SDGs in their sector plans and budgets. - Capacity building to facilitate the integration of SDG targets and indicators in policy and planning frameworks - Support Ministries by preparing a paper on SDG Planning Guidelines - Train core team for 6 pilot Ministries
Output 3: A comprehensive advocacy, sensitization and awareness drive undertaken across the country on the SDGs to ensure no one is left behind. - Advocacy, sensitization and awareness creation workshops: training of Media and development of Award Criteria for SDGs. A Terms of Refence was development towards this exercise in consultation with Media Institute for Botswana. An Inception report was produced
Output 4: Enhanced support provided to policy development, knowledge products, South – south and triangular cooperation, human development and data for the development of SDGs to inform evidence based planning, monitoring, reporting on SDGs and related strategic interventions.
- Finalise SDGs Implementation Status Report for Botswana - Provide Technical Assistance for improvement of the SDGs statistical monitoring capacity for the country

2 meetings of the NSC were held for appreciating the workplan and the status of project implementation . The NSC also decided for Botswana to submit a voluntary national review report at the 2022 High Level political Forum for sustainable development . The training of SDG focal points was done virtually due to Coviid19 restrictions by the Government of Botswana. - The Roll Out commenced in 4 sectors and as at December 2021 all Ministries had facilitators appointed and were at different levels with the process. -Finalisation and Printing of SDGs Implementation Status Report for Botswana was done and the report was disseminated in different platforms

Output 1: Enhanced Capacity of the MFED through the SDGs National Secretariat to ably Coordinate and Lead the Implementation of SDGs in Botswana - Retention of the Project Manager within the SDGs National Secretariat
Output 2: Enhanced capacities of sector ministries and departments at national and subnational levels to plan for the localization and mainstreaming of the SDGs in their sector plans and budgets. - Capacity building to facilitate the integration of SDG targets and indicators in policy and planning frameworks - Support Ministries by preparing a paper on SDG Planning Guidelines - Train core team for 6 pilot Ministries
Output 3: A comprehensive advocacy, sensitization and awareness drive undertaken across the country on the SDGs to ensure no one is left behind. - Advocacy, sensitization and awareness creation workshops
Output 4: Enhanced support provided to policy development, knowledge products, South – south and triangular cooperation, human development and data for the development of SDGs to inform evidence based planning, monitoring, reporting on SDGs and related strategic interventions.
- Prepare a comprehensive SDGs Implementation Status Report for Botswana - Provide Technical Assistance for improvement of the SDGs statistical monitoring capacity for the country - Procurement of and MTE Evaluator

A paper titled, Draft SDG Planning Guidelines was produced Core Teams for the targeted pilot Ministries for the Project Roll Out was undertaken The Roll Our Project was kickstarted in 2 out of the 6 target Ministries. 2 of the 5 Stages of the Guidelines were achieved The Project Officer was hired, however the Project Manage resigned The SDG Implementation Status Report for Botswana was finalised and procurement for printing done

Output 1: Enhanced Capacity of the MFED through the SDGs National Secretariat to ably Coordinate and Lead the Implementation of SDGs in Botswana - Retention of the Project Manager within the SDGs National Secretariat - Development of a Guidance Note on the Coordination Role Executed by the MFED
Output 2: Enhanced capacities of sector ministries and departments at national and subnational levels to plan for the localization and mainstreaming of the SDGs in their sector plans and budgets. - Capacity building to facilitate the integration of SDG targets and indicators in policy and planning frameworks - Support localisation of SDGs at district level.
Output 3: A comprehensive advocacy, sensitization and awareness drive undertaken across the country on the SDGs to ensure no one is left behind. - Advocacy, sensitization and awareness creation workshop for Parliamentarians convened
Output 4: Enhanced support provided to policy development, knowledge products, South – south and triangular cooperation, human development and data for the development of SDGs to inform evidence based planning, monitoring, reporting on SDGs and related strategic interventions.
- Convene working session to synchronize targets, indicators, baselines and base years in the NDP 11 Performance Framework and SDGs DIF - Prepare a comprehensive SDGs National Report for Botswana - Provide Technical Assistance for improvement of the SDGs statistical monitoring capacity for the country - Procurement of and MTE Evaluator

Output 1: Project roll out continues with the support of the PM with emphasis on capacity building for SDGs Focal Points, Planning and Monitoring Officers as well as ensuring the effective functioning of the institutional mechanism for SDGs.
A Guidance Note was developed mainly to support the SDGs National Secretariat and MFED at large to effectively coordinate SDG implementation in the country. The note unbundles coordination and identifies the following seven (7) functions as being very critical to the successful implementation of the SDGs, clearly laying out the role of MFED [Planning and Budgeting; Advocacy Sensitization and Awareness Creation; Implementation; Monitoring, Data Collection, Analysis and Reporting; Research, Stakeholder Coordination and Resource Mobilization]. It has been presented to UNDP - HQ and is due to be presented to the National Steering Committee (NSC).
Output 2: Process Plan to facilitate integration of SDG targets and indicators in national policies, strategies and plan is at an advanced stage of development. Major interventions to facilitate the process will be workshops with line Ministries on specific goals which they are custodians. The ultimate objective is to increase the number of targets and indicators that have been mainstreamed in planning and policy frameworks using a structured approach so that progress on attainment of the goals can be systematically measured.
Ministry of Local Government and Rural Development is spearheading this process with the support of SDGs National Secretariat and UNDP. A Draft Monitoring Framework with Goals and specific targets and indicators to be localized is under development.
Output 3:
A working session with the Parliamentary select committee on SDGs is being prepared for the new Committee that will be set up following the national elections scheduled for October 2019.
Output 4: Three day working session convened in June 2019 for 3 pilot ministries (Agriculture and Food Security; Environment, Natural Resource Conservation and Tourism; and Youth Sports and Culture) to identify Ministry specific goals, targets and indicators; interpret and prioritize the indicators; synchronize inconsistencies in indicators, baselines and base years between the SDGs and NDP 11 monitoring frameworks where applicable. This was done in preparation for the NDP 11 Mid Term review.
Terms of Reference prepared and consultancy team commissioned to prepare a comprehensive report on the status of implementation of SDGs in Botswana. The report will among other things, indicate the extent to which programmes, policies and strategies are available to support the attainment of SDGs in the country as well as the extent to which the targets and indicators have been mainstreamed in policy and planning frameworks.
Discussions ongoing with Statistics Botswana and concept note being prepared on the most feasible option or route to take to expand the SDGs statistical monitoring capacity in the country. The objective is to support SB working hand in hand with line Ministries, departments and agencies to compile, analyse and generate SDGs indicator data from available administrative data within the MDAs.
